quiz.title: Economics: Supply, Cost, Market Equilibrium, and Market Structure

questions.question: The supply of a good refers to _________ :
options: Quantity of the good offered for sale at a particular price per unit of time
questions.explanation: Supply is the quantity of a good that producers are willing and able to sell at various prices during a given time period.

questions.question: The cost of one thing in terms of the alternative given up is called _________ :
questions.explanation: Opportunity cost represents the value of the next best alternative forgone when a choice is made.

questions.question: Assume that consumerâ€™s income and the number of sellers in the market for good X both falls. Based on this information, we can conclude with certainty that the equilibrium _________ :
questions.explanation: Decrease in income (if X is a normal good) decreases demand, and decrease in sellers decreases supply. Both shifts reduce equilibrium quantity. Price effect is ambiguous (demand shift lowers price, supply shift raises price), but quantity definitely falls.

questions.question: In which of the following market structure is the degree of control over the price of its product by a firm very large?
questions.explanation: A monopoly, with only one seller and no close substitutes, has the greatest control over price, facing the entire market demand curve.
